Context: Moving bees across borders or disease control zones is regulated to prevent spread of pests and notifiable diseases. Requirements differ by jurisdiction and change over time.
Policy & Initiatives: Common elements include health inspections, certificates, registration, and notification of movements. Some regions impose seasonal restrictions or require permits for high-risk areas.
Practical Actions: Check current official guidance before each move; keep inspection and treatment records; isolate arrivals for observation; avoid moving suspect stock; coordinate with landowners and growers.
Further Reading & Sources: Always verify with current competent-authority websites and association bulletins before transport.
